page.title: 02AGRICULTURE, HADLEIGH
page.content: The fields around Whatfield are mostly used for growing oil seed rape, barley and peas. When the barley is about 60 to 100 centimetres high it is cut and collected by a combine harvester.The grain is used for cattle feed,brewing and sometimes milled for flour. The oil-seed rape has very bright yellow flowers and makes the countryside look very pretty.It grows to at least one metre high and when the flowers die the pods grow which contain the seeds.The farmer leaves them to ripen until they turn black.When the seeds are ripe they are pressed for the oil and used for cooking or adding to many products. In this area the farmer also grows peas,it helps the land and is used for animal feed or sent to the vegetable market.
